content:
GH recently started automatically adding */- when hitting "enter" while typing a list/enumeration in a post. I find that rather irritating since it means I have to manually delete this at the end of the list, and since <enter> * <space> is muscle memory at this point so I don't need the machine to insert this.^^
Does anyone know if there is a way to disable this behavior? I have been unable to find one so far.

Not what you asked for, but you can use shift + enter to make a new line without list autocomplete.
https://github.blog/changelog/2020-12-15-markdown-list-syntax-now-autocompleted/

I have to manually delete this at the end of the list

Hit Enter twice to avoid this. (also not a direct answer)
I'd doubt there's a way to disable it directly. I use https://github.com/sindresorhus/refined-github, which might potentially be open to adding something if it's possible.
You can use the gh CLI tool and then use Vim (or whatever your $EDITOR is) to write issues :)
Though you can't use that for comments (yet), so that may not answer your question.
Or what I do: open a new vim buffer, write my thing, then :%y and paste it in my browser :)
thanks for the replies, looks like I'll need to adjust my muscle memory to use shift-enter more often^^

Jake Goulding said:

I'd doubt there's a way to disable it directly. I use https://github.com/sindresorhus/refined-github, which might potentially be open to adding something if it's possible.

I tried this (or a similar) extension before, but they had a hard time keeping up with GH changes. while some of the UI improvements were nice, losing them a few days once a month was irritating enough that I ended up disabling the extension.
